metadata.title: CVE-2023-42116 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Exim SMTP Challenge Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code ExecutionVulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code on affected installations of Exim. Authentication is notrequired to exploit this vulnerability.The specific flaw exists within the handling of NTLM challenge requests.The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length ofuser-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-basedbuffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in thecontext of the service account. Was ZDI-CAN-17515.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-base - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-config - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-daemon-light - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
eximon4 - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.93-13ubuntu1.8').
